maml:description.maml:para: Clears adminCount attribute, and enables inherited security on the passed object (User or Group).
Clears adminCount attribute, and enables inherited security on the passed object (User or Group).
SamAccountName of the object to be reseted.
SamAccountName of the object to be reseted.
[STRING] Sam Account Name of the object to be reseted.

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-AdAdminCount dvader
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-AdAdminCount -SamAccountName dvader

maml:description.maml:para: Find orphaned GPO
An orphaned GPO is an AD GPO object which is missing its corresponding GPT in SYSVOL. This CMDlet can find all orphaned GPOs, and can delete them.
Switch indicator to remove the Orphan GPO
Switch indicator to remove the Orphan GPO
[SWITCH] parameter (true or false). If present the value becomes TRUE, and the Orphan GPO will be removed

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdOrphanGPO
This example shows how to use this CMDlet with parameters
Get-AdOrphanGPO -RemoveOrphanGPO

maml:description.maml:para: Find orphaned GPT
An orphaned GPT is a SYSVOL subfolder structure which is missing its corresponding GPO in AD. This CMDlet can find all orphaned GPTs, and can delete them.
Switch indicator to remove the Orphan GPT
Switch indicator to remove the Orphan GPT
[SWITCH] parameter (true or false). If present the value becomes TRUE, and the Orphan GPT will be removed

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdOrphanGPT
This example shows how to use this CMDlet with parameters
Get-AdOrphanGPT -RemoveOrphanGPT

maml:description.maml:para: Find overlap Subnet objects.

This CMDlet reads all AD Subnet objects, and will look for any IP Range overlap Active Directory Sites and Services uses this information to optimize traffic (replication, authentication, authorization, etc) by providing the most optimal domain controller on the network. IP Layer 3 of the ASI model should be configured as subnet object, and each of these objects has to be associated to an existing site.
Switch indicator. If present (TRUE), the Site information will be displayed.
Switch indicator. If present (TRUE), the Site information will be displayed.
[SWITCH] (bool)

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet.
Get-AdOverlapSubnets
This example shows how to use this CMDlet including Site information
Get-AdOverlapSubnets -IncludeSite

maml:description.maml:para: Report on Semi-Privileged Users.

Provides a full report on existing Privileged and Semi-Privileged users. For this CMDlet to work properly, ALL privileged and SemiPrivileged accounts. must be located within the same OU. Failing to have all users located on the mentioned container will show an incorrect report.
Distinguished Name of the container where the Admin users are located.
Path where the HTML report will be saved.
Distinguished Name of the container where the Admin users are located.
Path where the HTML report will be saved.
[STRING] Admin User Account OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
[STRING] Path where the HTML report will be saved. (ej. C:\Reports\MyReport.html).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdSemiPrivilegedUsersReport "OU=Admin Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet indicating report path
Get-AdSemiPrivilegedUsersReport "OU=Admin Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" "C:\Reports\"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Get-AdSemiPrivilegedUsersReport -AdminUsersDN "OU=Admin Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters including path for the report
Get-AdSemiPrivilegedUsersReport -AdminUsersDN "OU=Admin Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" -Path "C:\Reports\"

maml:description.maml:para: Find stale computer in domain.

A stale computer is a computer which has not logon to the domain in a certain period of time. This time is calculated on the AD attribute LastLogonTimestamp. When this value is older than the value provided on the DaysOffset, the user is considered as stale. If the parameter DaysOffset (integer) is ommited,a default value of 45 will be used. The return object is a list of ComputerPrincipal Extended.
Days offset to search for the stale computer.
Days offset to search for the stale computer.
[INT] Integer representing days offset to search for the stale computer.

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdStaleComputer 30
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Get-AdStaleComputer -DaysOffset 30

maml:description.maml:para: Find stale users in domain.

A stale user is a user which has not logon to the domain in a certain period of time. This time is calculated on the AD attribute LastLogonTimestamp. When this value is older than the value provided on the DaysOffset, the user is considered as stale. If the parameter DaysOffset (integer) is ommited,a default value of 45 will be used. The return object is a list of UserPrincipal Extended.
Days offset to search for the stale user.
Days offset to search for the stale user.
[INT] Integer representing days offset to search for the stale user.

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdStaleUser 30
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Get-AdStaleUser -DaysOffset 30

maml:description.maml:para: Find unlinked GPOs
Find unlinked GPO in the domain. Remove those if switch is present
Switch indicator to remove the UnLinked GPOs
Switch indicator to remove the UnLinked GPOs
[SWITCH] parameter (true or false). If present the value becomes TRUE, and the UnLinked GPOs will be removed

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-AdUnLinkedGPO
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Get-AdUnLinkedGPO -RemoveUnLinkedGpo

maml:description.maml:para: Clears adminCount attribute, and enables inherited security on all the passed group objects.
Finds all group objects (From specific OU and childs, or All Domain), and clears adminCount attribute, enabling inherited security on the passed group objectlist.
If present, all groups in the domain should be processed
If present, only groups of a sub-tree OU should be processed.
Distinguished Name where the search starts.
If present, all groups in the domain should be processed
If present, only groups of a sub-tree OU should be processed.
Distinguished Name where the search starts.
[SWITCH] Indicating if all groups in the domain should be processed.
[SWITCH] Indicating only a sub-tree OU should be processed.
[STRING] Representing the Distinguished Name where the search starts (ej. OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters finding all groups with adminCount = 1 in the domain
Set-AllGroupAdminCount -all
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters finding all groups with adminCount = 1 in specific OU
Set-AllGroupAdminCount -SubTree -SearchRootDN "OU=Admin Accounts,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"

maml:description.maml:para: Clears adminCount attribute, and enables inherited security on all the passed user objects.
Finds all user objects (From specific OU and childs, or All Domain), and clears adminCount attribute, and enables inherited security on the passed user objectlist.
If present, all users in the domain should be processed
If present, only users of a sub-tree OU should be processed.
Distinguished Name where the search starts.
If present, all users in the domain should be processed
If present, only users of a sub-tree OU should be processed.
Distinguished Name where the search starts.
[SWITCH] (bool) Indicating if all users in the domain should be processed.
[SWITCH] Indicating only a sub-tree OU should be processed.
[STRING] Representing the Distinguished Name where the search starts (ej. OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters finding all users with adminCount = 1 in the domain
Set-AllUserAdminCount -all
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters finding all users with adminCount = 1 in specific OU
Set-AllUserAdminCount -SubTree -SearchRootDN "OU=Admin Accounts,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"

maml:description.maml:para: Function for consistency check on semi-privileged accounts

For each of the user accounts stored within the USERS container of Admin Area, all groups will be enumerated and evaluated.In case that any of the groups the user belongs to are not part of Admin Area and/or BuiltIn container, will be removed from the user.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
[STRING] Admin User Account OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-NonPrivilegedGroupHousekeeping "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-NonPrivilegedGroupHousekeeping -AdminUsersDN "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"

maml:description.maml:para: Function for Privileged Computers housekeeping
PAWs and Infrastructure Services must be managed by Tier0 administrators and services. Each typemust belong to a certain group(SL_PAWS or SL_InfrastructureServices) in order to be mantained.
Distinguished Name of the container where the computers are located.
Distinguished Name of the container where the computers are located.
[STRING] Admin OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-PrivilegedComputerHousekeeping "OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-PrivilegedComputerHousekeeping -SearchRootDN "OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"

maml:description.maml:para: Function for Privileged Groups housekeeping

Ensure that any group stored on Admin OU (Tier0) contains only authorized users. An Authorized user is a user created and mantained by the Tier0 Admins, and is usually identified by the SamAccountName suffix of either _T0, or _T1 or _T2. Any non authorized user will be inmediatelly revoked from these groups.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
Userlist to be excluded from this process.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
Userlist to be excluded from this process.
[STRING] Admin Users OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
List[STRING] user list array

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet.
Set-PrivilegedGroupsHousekeeping "OU=Groups,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters.
Set-PrivilegedGroupsHousekeeping -AdminUsersDN "OU=Groups,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters and provides a exclusion list.
Set-PrivilegedGroupsHousekeeping -AdminUsersDN "OU=Groups,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" -ExcludeList "dvader", "hsolo"

maml:description.maml:para: Function for Privileged Users housekeeping

For each of the user accounts stored within the USERS container, make it part of the corresponding admin tier group. For example, if the user account is a Tier2 account(_T2), the user must belong to SG_Tier2Admins group.
Distinguished Name of the container where the Admin users are located.
Switch indicator to disable all Non-Standard users
Distinguished Name of the container where the Admin users are located.
Switch indicator to disable all Non-Standard users
[STRING] Admin User Account OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
SWITCH parameter (true or false). If present the value becomes TRUE, and

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-PrivilegedUsersHousekeeping "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-PrivilegedUsersHousekeeping -AdminUsersDN "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters and removing Non-Standard users.
Set-PrivilegedUsersHousekeeping -AdminUsersDN "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" -DisableNonStandardUsers

maml:description.maml:para: Generate random password
Generate random password, with defined length and complexity.
Length of the password to be generated.
Password complexity. Low use lowercase characters. Medium uses aditional upercase characters. High uses additional number characters. VeryHigh uses additional special characters.
Length of the password to be generated.
Password complexity. Low use lowercase characters. Medium uses aditional upercase characters. High uses additional number characters. VeryHigh uses additional special characters.
[INT] Length of the password to be generated.
[ValidateSet] Low, Medium, High or VeryHigh

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Get-RandomPassword -PasswordLength 14 -PasswordComplexity VeryHigh
This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Get-RandomPassword 14 VeryHigh
Create a new 10 Character Password of Uppercase/Lowercase/Numbers and store as a Secure.String in Variable called $MYPASSWORD
$MYPASSWORD = CONVERTTO-SECURESTRING (Get-RandomPassword -Length 10 -Complexity High) -asplaintext -force

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Scheduled Tasks which executes Set-AllGroupAdminCount
Create a new Scheduled Tasks, which will trigger 12 times per day. The Action configured is a PowerShell function from the Housekeeping module: Set-AllGroupAdminCount.
SamAccountName of the service account (or gMSA) used to execute the scheduled task.
SamAccountName of the service account (or gMSA) used to execute the scheduled task.
[String] SamAccountName of the group managed service account used to execute the scheduled task.

This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-ScheduleAllGroupAdminCount "SA_R2D2"

Set-ScheduleServiceAccounts "SA_R2D2" "OU=Service Accounts,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" "SG_T0SA"

maml:description.maml:para: Integrity check of Semi-Privileged accounts.

A Semi-Privileged account can only exist if a Non-Privileged account (standard user) does exists. This is called Key-Pair. If the key-pair non-privileged account (standard user) gets disabled, the semi-privileged account must be disabled as well. If the key-pair non-privileged account (standard user) does not exist, the Semi-Privileged account must be deleted inmediatelly. This function will read all Semi-Privileged accounts and will search its key-pair (SID of the non privileged account), applying the mentioned actions. For this check to work properly, all semi-privileged accounts should have the non-privileged SID stored on the employeeNumber attribute.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
Userlist to be excluded from this process.
Distinguished Name of the container where the users are located.
Userlist to be excluded from this process.
[STRING] Admin User Account OU Distinguished Name. (ej. OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
List[STRING] user list array

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet.
Set-SemiPrivilegedKeyPairCheck "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" "TheGood", "TheUgly"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters.
Set-SemiPrivilegedKeyPairCheck -AdminUsersDN "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" -ExcludeList "TheGood", "TheUgly"
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using splatting.
$params = @{ AdminUsersDN = "OU=Users,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" ExcludeList = "TheGood", "TheUgly" Verbose = $True } Set-SemiPrivilegedKeyPairCheck @params

maml:description.maml:para: Create or modify a Semi-Privileged account.
Create or modify a Semi-Privileged account.

Valid Email of the target user. This address will be used to send information to her/him.

SMTP server.

Path to the body template file.

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
New-SemiPrivilegedUser dvader dvader@eguibarit.com T0 'OU=Admin Accounts,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local' 'DelegationModel@eguibarit.com' 'smtpout.europe.secureserver.net'
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters

New-SemiPrivilegedUser -SamAccountName dvader -EmailTo dvader@eguibarit.com -AccountType T0 -AdminUsersDN 'OU=Admin Accounts,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local' -From 'DelegationModel@eguibarit.com' -SMTPserver 'smtpout.europe.secureserver.net'

[STRING] representing the valid user for authenticating to SMTP.
[STRING] representing the valid password for authenticating to SMTP (User is E-mail address of sender).
[STRING] representing the SMTP server.
[INT] representing the SMTP port number.
[STRING] representing the Password body template file.
[SWITCH] indicating if password has to be sent by encrypted email.

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-SemiPrivilegedUsersPwdReset dvader_t0
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-SemiPrivilegedUsersPwdReset -SamAccountName dvader_t0

maml:description.maml:para: Function for ServiceAccount housekeeping

For each of the service accounts stored within the SA container, make it part of the corresponding service account group based on its tier. For example, the container of Tier0 service accounts must belong to the group SG_T0SA.
Distinguished Name of the container where the Service Accounts are located.
Name of the corresponding tier service account group (For tier0: SG_T0SA; for Tier1: SG_T1SA; for Tier2: SG_T2SA).
Distinguished Name of the container where the Service Accounts are located.
Name of the corresponding tier service account group (For tier0: SG_T0SA; for Tier1: SG_T1SA; for Tier2: SG_T2SA).
[STRING] representing the Distinguished Name of the object (ej. OU=Users,OU=Good,OU=Sites,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local).
[STRING] Name of the corresponding tier service account group (For tier0: SG_T0SA; for Tier1: SG_T1SA; for Tier2: SG_T2SA)

maml:introduction.maml:para: This example shows how to use this CMDlet
Set-ServiceAccountHousekeeping "OU=T0,OU=SA,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" SG_T0SA
This example shows how to use this CMDlet using named parameters
Set-ServiceAccountHousekeeping -ServiceAccountDN "OU=T0,OU=SA,OU=Admin,DC=EguibarIT,DC=local" -SAGroupName SG_T0SA
